description: Construction of three storey building with mansard roof extension to provide five self-contained residential units (2 x studio, 2 x 1 bed, 1 x 2 bed); incorporating existing single storey building comprising two retail units (Use Class A1); associated external and internal alterations; provision of cycle parking and refuse/recycling storage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 7279/LP/01 (site location plan); 7279/PL/01 Rev C (proposed ground floor plan); 7279/PL/02 Rev C (proposed 1st & 2nd floor plan); 7279/PL/03 Rev C (proposed 3rd floor and roof plan); 7279/PL/04 Rev C (proposed front elevation); 7279/PL/05 Rev C (flank elevation, Sheepwalk Tavern); 7279/PL/06 Rev C (proposed rear elevation); 7279/PL/07 Rev C (proposed section AA); 7279/PL/08 Rev C (Street elevation design comparison); 7279/PL/09 Rev C (proposed section BB).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those indicated in the approved plans. The colour of the rear metal window frames and balustrades shall be dark grey/black.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A &  7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Existing trees adjacent/close to the boundaries of the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees. Protection of the trees, hedgerows and groups of mature shrubs off site that are adjacent/close to it shall be carried out only in accordance with British Standard 5837:2005 'Trees In Relation To Construction Recommendations' (or any subsequent revision), and shall be maintained fully intact and (in the case of the fencing) at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site.

Reason:  In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area as a whole, policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1 (e) (g), 1.2(f), 3.1(b) and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | A scheme shall be provided for supplying fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on Market Place, Acton facade. The supply to be provided from the rear of the building at high level. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to first occupation of the housing hereby approved, an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh shall be installed into the dwelling and thereafter permanently retained.
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o	Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
o	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2015); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | The insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the residential units shall achieve an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), 0r NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, a refuse management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved. The details of the refuse management plan shall be fully implemented as approved prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse storage in accordance with policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016) and to ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development and surrounding area in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013)
| At least eight (8) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.9 and table 6.3.
